What are the standard locations for installing Verus Desktop, depending on whether you want to install it for all users or just yourself?

The standard locations for installing Verus Desktop are:
- `%ProgramFiles%\Verus-Desktop` for all users
- `%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Programs\Verus-Desktop` for just yourself

# Standard file location for Verus Desktop The installer for Verus-Desktop suggests a standard location to install to, depending on the choice whether you want to install it for all users or just yourself. ## Anyone who uses the computer (All Users) `%ProgramFiles%\Verus-Desktop` ## Only me: `%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Programs\Verus-Desktop` Normally you don't need to worry about these locations, but in some instances you will be asked by community members providing support to look up a file in a folder in your Verus-Desktop installation. note: changing files in these folders or subfolders may result in a corrupt installation. Only do so when instructed by our support community members. ## Deamons The daemons are located in the `komodod`, `verusd` and `zcashd` folders that can be found in the `resources\app\assets\bin\win64\` subfolder of your installation folder. ## Program settings Verus Desktop saves it program settings on a different folder: `%AppData%\Verus-Desktop` The users settings are stored in `appdata\config.json` in the program settings folder. ## Standard chain data and wallet locations #### KMD `%AppData%\Komodo` ### Verus `%AppData%\Komodo\VRSC` #### Komodo asset chains Any Komodo asset chain will create a subfolder in the KMD chain data and wallet folder, which is standard named. The names will be in capitals and are identical to the **official** asset-chain name. `%AppData%\Komodo\<CHAIN-NAME>` Note: examples Pirate: `%AppData%\Komodo\PIRATE` Utrum: `%AppData%\Komodo\OOT` Zexo: `%AppData%\Komodo\ZEXO` And so on... For easy access to the binaries folders, Verus-Desktop program settings and VRSC chain folder and all binary folders, you can use the debug menu in Verus-Desktop. note: updated at 2020-12-03 by Oink.vrsc@
./raw_txt_input/winfaq-03_verus_desktop_locations.md
What is the location of the daemons in Verus Desktop, and what are they named?
The daemons are located in the `resources\app\assets\bin\win64\` subfolder of your installation folder, and they are named `komodod`, `verusd`, and `zcashd`.

Where does Verus Desktop store its program settings?
Verus Desktop stores its program settings in the `%AppData%\Verus-Desktop` folder, and the user settings are stored in the `appdata\config.json` file within that folder.

Where are the standard chain data and wallet locations for Komodo and Verus?

The standard chain data and wallet locations are:
- `%AppData%\Komodo` for Komodo
- `%AppData%\Komodo\VRSC` for Verus

Where are the standard locations for Komodo asset chain data and wallets?

The standard locations for Komodo asset chain data and wallets are subfolders of the Komodo chain data and wallet folder, named after the official asset chain name in capital letters. For example:
- `%AppData%\Komodo\PIRATE` for the Pirate asset chain
- `%AppData%\Komodo\OOT` for the Utrum asset chain
- `%AppData%\Komodo\ZEXO` for the Zexo asset chain

How can I easily access the binaries folders, Verus-Desktop program settings, and VRSC chain folder?
You can easily access these folders using the debug menu in Verus-Desktop.
